pr_title: Add session end fields to Crashlytics reports

timeline.message: Add with function to set all session end fields at once
Set fields at session finalize time

timeline.body: if it is not relevant to the test, I'm happy with inlining, e.g., 0L for all of these
timeline.bodyText: if it is not relevant to the test, I'm happy with inlining, e.g., 0L for all of these
timeline.bodyHTML: if it is not relevant to the test, I'm happy with inlining, e.g., 0L for all of these
timeline.author: jakeouellette

timeline.bodyHTML:
this finalizeReports call is pretty nested. Suggestion:

Refactor to make it so this method is much shorter, like:

writeReport(...);
recursiveDelete(sessionDirectory);

Then in writeReport(...), flip the two nested ifs into early terminating statements:

if (eventFiles.isEmpty()) {
  return;
}
...
if (report == null) {
  // TODO: Handle null case
  return
}```
timeline.author: jakeouellette

timeline.body:
This didn't break any CrashlyticsController tests. Do we not mock reportingCoordinator in those tests to check it was called in unit?

... one pattern I often see (and implement) is a TimeProvider interface that would do new Date().getTime() / 1000, what's nice about that pattern is then you could pass it in and mock it to make the tests not break (if they had)
timeline.bodyText:

... one pattern I often see (and implement) is a TimeProvider interface that would do new Date().getTime() / 1000, what's nice about that pattern is then you could pass it in and mock it to make the tests not break (if they had)
timeline.author: jakeouellette

replies.bodyText:
This didn't break any CrashlyticsController tests. Do we not mock reportingCoordinator in those tests to check it was called in unit?

Apparently not.

... one pattern I often see (and implement) is a TimeProvider interface that would do new Date().getTime() / 1000, what's nice about that pattern is then you could pass it in and mock it to make the tests not break (if they had)

I considered that pattern, and in fact we actually have a SystemCurrentTimeProvider, but I wasn't sure whether to pass it in here or into the constructor.
replies.author: mrwillis21

replies.bodyText:
Cool, there's probably a wider discussion about that which I'm happy to punt on, but we can chat about when you're interested.
Given that this change didn't break any tests, do you need to add any tests that validate this method?
replies.author: jakeouellette

replies.bodyText: I think we can do a separate pass and add tests for validating all of the SessionReportingCoordinator calls in CrashlyticsController.
replies.author: mrwillis21

timeline.message: Add helper method and make code more readable

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
isHighPriorityReport = isHighPriorityReport || isHighPriorityEventFile(eventFile.getName());
isHighPriorityReport |= isHighPriorityEventFile(eventFile.getName());
timeline.author: jakeouellette

replies.bodyText: Personally I find this less clear, and would prefer we keep it as is if it's all the same to you.
replies.author: mrwillis21
